channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: Bulldozing UNRWA’s HQ Is an Attack on the UN, Spokesperson Says
item.description: The United Nations on Tuesday condemned Israel’s demolition of the headquarters compound of the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA), in East Jerusalem, describing the move as an attack on the world body itself. Farhan Haq, the deputy spokesperson for Secretary-General António Guterres, rejected the Israeli claim that the compound had stopped ... Read more

item.title: Guinea’s Path to Electoral Autocracy
item.description: In December, the dust settled on Guinea’s first presidential election since the military took control in a 2021 coup. General Mamady Doumbouya stayed in power after receiving 87 per cent of the vote. But the outcome was never in doubt: this was no a democratic milestone; it was the culmination of Guinea’s denied transition to […]

item.title: World Living Beyond Its Means: Warns UN’s Global Water Bankruptcy Report
item.description: The world has entered what United Nations researchers now describe as an era of Global Water Bankruptcy, a condition where humanity has irreversibly overspent the planet’s water resources, leaving ecosystems, economies, and communities unable to recover to previous levels. The new report, released by the United Nations University Institute for Water, Environment and Health, titled Global Water […]

item.title: Devex Invested: A year of new partners, new presidents, and new promises
item.description: As Western aid declines, the future of global development finance is shifting toward private capital, Gulf funds, and domestic revenue.

item.title: From breakthroughs to better lives: The path to dengue-free communities
item.description: In Brazil, scientists and communities are teaming up to release mosquitoes that block dengue transmission. This visual story follows the journey from lab to neighborhood, showing how R&D protects communities from disease.

item.title: Devex Newswire: Courts take their sweet time ruling on Trump's aid purge
item.description: The legal fight to preserve billions in U.S. aid. Plus, a battle rages within the U.K.’s outpost of Oxfam.

item.title: UNRWA headquarters bulldozed in East Jerusalem
item.description: The reported demolition underway early Tuesday of the headquarters of UN agency UNRWA by Israeli forces in occupied East Jerusalem - apparently “under the watch of lawmakers and a member of the Government” - has prompted swift condemnation from the global body.

item.title: Mozambique floods heighten disease, malnutrition risks – UN agencies
item.description: Catastrophic flooding across Mozambique is devastating lives and livelihoods, sharply increasing the risk of disease outbreaks and malnutrition, while also forcing dangerous wildlife – including crocodiles – into flooded urban areas, the UN warned on Tuesday.

item.title: Human trafficking depends on corruption at every step
item.description: In 2011, a trafficker in Chile was convicted for recruiting economically vulnerable Peruvian citizens and arranging for them to be brought into the country – destined to become victims of sexual exploitation.

item.title: Prison breaks and renewed clashes raise alarm in northeast Syria
item.description: The United Nations continues to monitor developments in northeast Syria following clashes between government troops and the Kurdish-led SDF militia during which scores of detained ISIL militants reportedly escaped from prison.

item.title: Cold and dark: UN rights chief condemns Russian strikes on Ukraine’s power grid
item.description: Russian attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure have cut heat, electricity and water to hundreds of thousands of civilians in freezing winter conditions, prompting the UN human rights chief to denounce the strikes as “cruel” and a clear violation of international law.

item.title: The value of collaboration among public development banks
item.description: How can public development banks better work together for maximum impact? Devex sat down with the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank’s immediate past president and chair of the board of directors, Jin Liqun.

item.title: Fighting for billions: The legal battle to keep US foreign aid alive
item.description: Frozen programs, delayed payments, and billions at stake. The lawsuit that tested the limits of U.S. foreign aid continues, nearly one year after it began.

item.title: Global Survey Finds Citizens back a World Parliament as Trust in International System Erodes
item.description: As democracy faces pressure around the world and confidence in international law drops, a new global survey reveals that citizens in a vast majority of countries support the idea of creating a citizen-elected world parliament to deal with global issues. The survey, commissioned by Democracy Without Borders and conducted across 101 countries representing 90% of […]
